New Records: Victor Wembanyama scored 29 points for the Spurs in the game.
Stephon Castle made a key free throw with 7.2 seconds remaining to secure the win for San Antonio.
Key Match Events: A scuffle broke out between Victor Wembanyama and Dillon Brooks over a loose ball in the third quarter.
The Rockets' Jalen Green scored 11 of his 29 points in the fourth quarter to spark a comeback.
The game was intense throughout, with the Spurs leading by 18 heading into the fourth quarter but ultimately holding on for the win after a dramatic finish.
Pre-Game Insights: San Antonio guard Jeremy Sochan fueled the rivalry by saying'(expletive) Houston!' during a pre-game press availability.
Rockets coach Ime Udoka emphasized the need for aggressive defense after the team struggled to guard initially.
Post-Match Reflections: San Antonio's Keldon Johnson said the team 'got to come in and try to repeat and get another win' after the victory.
Rockets coach Ime Udoka expressed frustration with the team's initial performance and said they had chances to win but didn't execute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Spurs and Rockets will also play each other on November 6 in Houston.
The rivalry between the two teams has been renewed as both fight for respectability after struggling to make the playoffs since the 2019-20 season.
Others: The Spurs broke open a close game with a 20-3 run over the final 9.5 minutes of the second quarter.
